title: Brazilian Grilled Pineapple Recipe
description: These delicious grilled pineapple slices are coated in a simple mix of brown sugar and cinnamon to create this Brazilian steakhouse favorite.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Brazilian Grilled Pineapple 4.9 (101) 75 Reviews 17 Photos These grilled pineapple slices are a favorite at a Brazilian steakhouse in Dallas. Not sure if this is the exact recipe they use but it tastes very close. Great side for kabobs and steak. Submitted by SoccerNut Updated on February 13, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 17 17 17 17 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 6 Yield: 6 wedges Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 cup brown sugar 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon 1 pineapple - peeled, cored, and cut into 6 wedges Directions Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate. Whisk brown sugar and cinnamon together in a bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Transfer into a large resealable plastic bag. Add pineapple wedges to the bag; shake well to coat each wedge. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Grill pineapple wedges on the preheated grill until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes per side. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 280 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Brazilian Grilled Pineapple 01 of 17 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 17 Photo by  Dairy Princess 05/01/2021 Baked fresh pineapple at 375F. 30 minutes. Delicious. 03 of 17 Photo by  ambieb14 02/19/2021 04 of 17 Photo by  Mitch 05/17/2019 05 of 17 Photo by  MohammedulBaqir N Kalimi 11/17/2018 06 of 17 Photo by  shannon 07/06/2018 07 of 17 Photo by  Shellie Draper 03/01/2018 Awesome recipe! I used the recipe as is and added vanilla extract as mentioned in other comments. I also baked instead of grilled and results were perfect! Definitely making again but would like to add some dough for a cobbler effect. 08 of 17 Photo by  mrohde 07/09/2017 Real simple recipe... I think I may add vanilla or soak the pineapple in rum prior to grilling next time. 09 of 17 Photo by  Jamie Iglesias 02/28/2017 10 of 17 Photo by  AdvoMom 01/27/2017 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Honey Key Lime Grilled Chicken 61 Ratings Grilled Butternut Squash 7 Ratings Hawaiian Chicken Pineapple Kabobs 798 Ratings Quick and Easy Grilled Potatoes 170 Ratings Bacon Apples 16 Ratings Grilled Lemon-Pepper Zucchini 52 Ratings Grilled Peaches in Foil 3 Ratings Grilled Pineapple Mango Salsa 14 Ratings Soy-Glazed Corn on the Cob 5 Ratings Quick Savory Grilled Peaches 19 Ratings Grilled Asparagus 868 Ratings Grilled Peaches 45 Ratings Tajin Grilled Pineapple 1 Rating Ultra Easy Pineapple Chicken Kabobs 74 Ratings Easy Roasted Cabbage 28 Ratings Texas BBQ Chicken 71 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: SoccerNut
instructions: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.;Whisk brown sugar and cinnamon together in a bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Transfer into a large resealable plastic bag. Add pineapple wedges to the bag; shake well to coat each wedge. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Grill pineapple wedges on the preheated grill until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes per side. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
